channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA

item.title: Report X-2024120531
item.description:
Report X-2024120531

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-11T12:32:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-13
  • City: WATERLOO
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Chicago Central and Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 20183
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 11-13-2024 A CN Mechanical employee observed liquid dripping from the bottom outlet valve of rail car # CBTX 737709 while performing an inbound train inspection at the CN Waterloo Yard in Waterloo, Iowa. The employee notified the CN Yard Coordinator who in turn made proper notifications to all departments. CN Dangerous Goods Contractor upon arrival and inspection found the bottom outlet valve cap to be less than tool tight and the bottom outlet valve handle to be in the fully closed position. CN Dangerous Goods Contractor upon arrival and inspection found the bottom outlet valve cap to be less than tool tight so they open and closed the the valve and replaced a damaged gasket and retightened to tool tight.

item.title: Report E-2024120123
item.description:
Report E-2024120123

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-10T12:24:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-09
  • City: ALTOONA
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improper loading. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail. The damaged pail was overpacked into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
